_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Dorman Brothers, LLC-Karvel Location

For further information regarding this plan, please contact:
Michael B. Dorman
19230 County Rd. 55
Burlington, Colorado 80807
 719/346-7970

1. Facility Policy
The owners, members, and employees of Dorman Brothers, LLC are committed to the prevention of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the business is prepared to work with the local fire department and other agencies to mitgate and minimze the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information
This facility makes sure that the most current safety measures are implemented.  The primary activity at this faciltiy is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application.  The ammonia is delivered in by truck.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program
This facility has implemented the provisions of Safety Reguirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonis K-61-1, published by the American National Standards, Institute, Inc. and the standards of the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR 1920-111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

4.  The Five Year Accident History
There have been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

5.  The Emergency Action Plan
The Facility has:
-A written Emergency Action Plan
-Trained employees
-SARA Title III information and turns it in to the state and local authorities  

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvements are an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic inspections are performed to assess the maintenace of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.
